verses.text:
||Proud Edom Will Be Brought Low||The vision of Obadiah.
Thus says the Lord God concerning Edom:  
We have heard a report from the LORD,  
    and a messenger has been sent among the nations:  
"Rise up! Let us rise against it for battle!"

I will surely make you least among the nations;  
    you shall be utterly despised.

Your proud heart has deceived you,  
    you that live in the clefts of the rock,[^a]  
    whose dwelling is in the heights.  
You say in your heart,  
    "Who will bring me down to the ground?"

Though you soar aloft like the eagle,  
    though your nest is set among the stars,  
    from there I will bring you down,  
says the LORD.

||Pillage and Slaughter Will Repay Edom"s Cruelty||If thieves came to you,  
    if plunderers by night  
    --how you have been destroyed!--  
    would they not steal only what they wanted?  
If grape-gatherers came to you,  
    would they not leave gleanings?

How Esau has been pillaged,  
    his treasures searched out!

footnotes.a: Obadiah 1:7 Cn: Heb lacks _those who ate_

verses.text:
On that day, says the LORD,  
    I will destroy the wise out of Edom,  
    and understanding out of Mount Esau.

Your warriors shall be shattered, O Teman,  
    so that everyone from Mount Esau will be cut off.

||Edom Mistreated His Brother||For the slaughter and violence done to your brother Jacob,  
    shame shall cover you,  
    and you shall be cut off forever.

On the day that you stood aside,  
    on the day that strangers carried off his wealth,  
and foreigners entered his gates  
    and cast lots for Jerusalem,  
    you too were like one of them.

footnotes.a: Obadiah 1:12 Heb _But do not gloat_ (and similarly through verse 14)

verses.text:
You should not have stood at the crossings  
    to cut off his fugitives;  
you should not have handed over his survivors  
    on the day of distress.

For as you have drunk on my holy mountain,  
    all the nations around you shall drink;  
they shall drink and gulp down,[^a]  
    and shall be as though they had never been.

Those of the Negeb shall possess Mount Esau,  
    and those of the Shephelah the land of the Philistines;  
they shall possess the land of Ephraim and the land of Samaria,  
    and Benjamin shall possess Gilead.

footnotes.b: Obadiah 1:20 Cn: Meaning of Heb uncertain

verses.text:
The exiles of the Israelites who are in Halah[^a]  
    shall possess[^b] Phoenicia as far as Zarephath;  
and the exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad  
    shall possess the towns of the Negeb.
I will surely make you least among the nations;
